Texts.Chs: <译文: 首先，他们不相信我关于^red;<未知>^reset;的说辞。然后他们说我疯了，竟然认为这样的生物会存在。现在他们就在^red;<未知>^reset;我告诉他们要避免去的地方。事实上是两次。然而，我坐在这间牢房里，等待着因为^red;<未知>^reset;的谎言而死去，而他们却在调查我被告知在这个现实世界中不可能存在的东西。>
Texts.Eng: <Translation: First, they did not believe me about ^red;<unknown>^reset;. Then they said I was crazy to even think such a creature could exist. And now they are ^red;<unknown>^reset; right where I told them to avoid. Twice, in fact. Yet here I sit in this cell, awaiting my death due to ^red;<unknown>^reset; lies, while they investigate the very thing that I was told could not exist in this reality.>

Texts.Chs: ^red;<未知>^reset;霸权！他们是谎言和欺骗之父。现在他们用贪婪毁灭了我们的人民。在某种程度上，我认为把我们的鼻子伸到不该伸的地方是理想的惩罚。科学并不意味着知道所有的事情。现在，我们自己的狂妄将永远吞噬着我们。>
Texts.Eng: ^red;<unknown>^reset; the Hegemony! They are fathers of lies, and of deceptions. And now they have doomed our people in their greed. In a way, I suppose it is poetic justice for sticking our nose where it doesn't belong. Science is not meant to know all things. And now our own hubris consumes us forever.>
